metadata.name: IMAGHOSTXO EDITIONS 01 : LADDERS #1
metadata.description:
THE IMAGHOSTXO EDITIONS SERIES :

LADDERS is the first of what I hope to be a 5 Edition Series that ultimately leads to a final, “Special Piece.” Each Edition in the Series will increase in quantity and decrease in price. Collectors w/ a 52BODIES at the time of each EDITION launch receives that EDITION.

The IMAGHOSTXO EDITIONS PRICING AND RELEASE PLAN:  
  E01 : LADDERS - 15 @ .03  
  E02 : XXX -  20 @ .025  
  E03 : XXX - 30 @ .02  
  E04 : XXX - 40 @ .015  
  E05  : XXX - 52 @ .01  


Those who collect all 5 Editions earn access to an EXCLUSIVE IMAGHOSTXO COLLAGE @ .005

THE IMAGE :   If you know me from 52BODIES, you know I usually don’t gravitate toward images where I or the camera are acknowledged. Instead, I pursue an approach that uncovers candid, unposed moments that reveal ephemeral alignments appearing and disappearing around us every second of every day. 

I noticed this moment shaping up a couple of blocks away when I heard the foreman of a construction crew calling up to his men. The instant I realized there was a possibility the crew might line up, I sprinted to a spot in the street, directly under the foreman, where I laid down with my head against the edge of the sidewalk, looking straight up. Having such a high vantage point, this was easy for the crew to see happening. Also, looking down at their foreman, it was certainly impossible not to notice a guy lying flat in the street directly below them. This time I didn’t mind that I would be seen taking the photograph. The moment was quick, and the resulting image had such great energy that I instantly came to love it as one of my favorite DTLA RISING images; the last shot at the end of a great day that embodied a feeling of hope and unity in the city that didn’t always feel in harmony.
